article_title: Shopping for the right private exchange
article_text:
Walgreens announced this fall it would stop offering health insurance directly to its workers in 2014, instead shifting them to policies in a private insurance exchange.

An estimated 1 million people are expected to enroll in private health exchanges this year, and, if predictions hold out, that number could grow to 40 million by 2018.

Will these private health exchanges provide the array of coverage options needed? Will they help save employers money? Just who are the major players in the private exchange business, and what differentiates one from the next?

article_summary:
Will these private health exchanges provide the array of coverage options needed?
Walgreens announced this fall it would stop offering health insurance directly to its workers in 2014, instead shifting them to policies in a private insurance exchange.
An estimated 1 million people are expected to enroll in private health exchanges this year, and, if predictions hold out, that number could grow to 40 million by 2018.
Just who are the major players in the private exchange business, and what differentiates one from the next?
Will they help save employers money?
